Clip.Title: THE REAL STORY
Clip.EpisodeSummary: We take an in-depth, behind-the-scenes look at the CIA to see how a super assassin like Matt Damon's conflicted hero is created. We also probe the intelligence agency's controversial past operations, involving sinister mind-control experiments and often bizarre assassination plots.

Clip.Title: DESIGN TRIENNIEL
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Join host Susan Spencer as we enter the Cooper Hewitt National Design Museum, where curators have assembled a remarkable collection of groundbreaking innovations that are making the world safer, more comfortable, and energy efficient.

Clip.Title: STORIES FROM THE VAULTS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: What does the Smithsonian have to do with food? Join host Tom Cavanagh as he learns to cook Native American dishes with the executive chef of Mitsitam Cafe; experience the American coffee break with the National Museum of American History, and visit the National Museum of Dentistry.

Clip.Title: STORIES FROM THE VAULTS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Join host Tom Cavanagh as he takes you behind the scenes to examine the treasures, secret symbols, and coded messages that you can find at the Smithsonian. With the help of curators and other experts, we unlock some of the Smithsonian's most compelling mysteries.

Clip.Title: THE REAL STORY
Clip.EpisodeSummary: We take an in-depth, behind-the-scenes look at the CIA to see how a super assassin like Matt Damon's conflicted hero is created. We also probe the intelligence agency's controversial past operations, involving sinister mind-control experiments and often bizarre assassination plots.

Clip.Title: DESIGN TRIENNIEL
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Join host Susan Spencer as we enter the Cooper Hewitt National Design Museum, where curators have assembled a remarkable collection of groundbreaking innovations that are making the world safer, more comfortable, and energy efficient.

Clip.Title: AERIAL FRANCE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Get an up close look at the beautiful French landscape from above and a taste of the rich culture on the stunning coasts.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The Eastern Coastline of New Brunswick is an ecological wonder- this aerial survey soars above incredible rock formations, peat farms, and some of the East Coast's most impressive sand dunes.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From the port city of Halifax, to the historic Acadian shores and international waters beyond, this aerial exploration documents the treasures and mysteries of Nova Scotia's Southern coast.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE

Clip.EpisodeSummary: We take an in-depth, behind-the-scenes look at the CIA to see how a super assassin like Matt Damon's conflicted hero is created. We also probe the intelligence agency's controversial past operations, involving sinister mind-control experiments and often bizarre assassination plots.

Clip.Title: DESIGN TRIENNIEL
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Join host Susan Spencer as we enter the Cooper Hewitt National Design Museum, where curators have assembled a remarkable collection of groundbreaking innovations that are making the world safer, more comfortable, and energy efficient.

Clip.Title: KURU: SCIENCE AND THE SORCERY
Clip.EpisodeSummary: An Australian researcher discovers the cause of a crippling plague in New Guinea, and finds how the affliction the isolated tribe suffers from became a global concern.

Clip.Title: BAD BLOOD: A CAUTIONARY TALE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: See how a 'miracle' treatment became an agent of death, and how a community launched a fight to right the system that failed them to make it safer for all.

Clip.Title: THE VACCINE ACCORDING TO BILL GATES
Clip.Episode: The Vaccine According to Bill Gates
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Malaria kills between one and three million people each year, and almost 500 million are contaminated with the disease throughout the world. For the past 80 years, researchers have been unsuccessful at finding a cure. However, we may be about to witness a breakthrough.

Clip.Title: QUEST
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Covering developments in astronomy, biology, chemistry, engineering, the environment, geology, health, physics and the weather, Quest delves deep into subject matter that is often inaccesible to the public, to satisfy your curiousity and to illuminate the wonders of contemporary science and research.

Clip.Title: I HAVE SEEN THE EARTH CHANGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: With its' lower than sea-level countryside, the Netherlands has a big problem on its hands if sea levels keep rising.

Clip.Title: I HAVE SEEN THE EARTH CHANGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Par' is the 2nd biggest State in Brazil. It is also the most exposed to climatic changes flirting with both extremes: long-time dryness followed by violent floods all year long.

Clip.Title: THE BIONIC VET
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Join the Bionic Vet and his staff as they tend to a puppy in shock, a police dog in agony and a cat about to take her first (reluctant) dip into the center's hydrotherapy pool.

Clip.Title: UNDERSEA EDENS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: One thousand miles off the southeast coast of Argentina sits the sub-Antarctic island of South Georgia in the Southern Ocean. About the size of Rhode Island, it's a breathtaking sight - long and narrow - shaped like a huge fractured whalebone. Massive glaciers, ice caps and snowfields cover about 75% of the island, but the land is far from desolate

Clip.Title: ANIMALS ALOFT
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Look into the archives of the National Air and Space Museum where incredible stories of thrilling adventures will be revealed, all with animals riding shotgun.

Clip.Title: MISSION PARADISE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Paradise is a myth, a dream, a utopia, a religious concept. But for many people, it is above all a quest. In the four corners of the planet, Mako, Amina Alaoui, Adolf Hvll, Ibis and Jean Delumeau have got a little closer to paradise than anyone else. This is their story, both a travelogue and their personal diaries.

Clip.Title: THE BIONIC VET
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Join the Bionic Vet and his staff as they tend to a puppy in shock, a police dog in agony and a cat about to take her first (reluctant) dip into the center's hydrotherapy pool.

Clip.Title: UNDERSEA EDENS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: One thousand miles off the southeast coast of Argentina sits the sub-Antarctic island of South Georgia in the Southern Ocean. About the size of Rhode Island, it's a breathtaking sight - long and narrow - shaped like a huge fractured whalebone. Massive glaciers, ice caps and snowfields cover about 75% of the island, but the land is far from desolate
